history.content:
1. Can anyone(esp transfer students from cc like me) share their timeline in job-hunting?

I won't be able to take CS uppers until next Spring (want to focus on declaration courses), so I don't think I am as qualified as other students who finished those courses early. However, I really wish to have an internship for my junior year summer break. My goal after graduation is to get a full-time job from FLG.

2. How can we take advantage of the career fair/career center/anything else at Cal?

Community colleges didn't provide me enough resources/training on job-hunting. All my experiences were from my networking/LinkedIn/Glassdoor. I am wondering how Cal students do job-hunting in general? I heard that campus recruiting events were indeed helpful. 

3.Suggested Upper-division courses that are useful for working as an SDE?

In other words, project-based instead of theoretical I guess?

4. How can I find software engineering opportunities on campus?

Examples: Hackathons (I know CalHacks), project-based courses/DeCal/Club events, or even LeetCode group.

Thanks a ton for any advice. :)
history.subject: Transfer Student Sample Timeline (SDE Career)
